messages.subject: Re: Simple Living   was Unschooling and funds
messages.msgSnippet: Hi everyone, I m one of those asocial types (thanks Sorcha, I like that much better!!) who rarely posts, but enjoy this list IMMENSLEY!  I just wanted to thank
messages.messageBody:
Hi everyone,
I'm one of those asocial types (thanks Sorcha, I like that much better!!)
who rarely posts, but enjoy this list IMMENSLEY! I just wanted to thank
TreeGoddess for the links below. It couldn't have come at a better time,
when, in my yearly spring cleaning, I come to terms that I have just too
much junk, and too much attachment. (for a Naturalist and Artist who has
Buddhist tendencies , these just aren't good things!)
Thank you!!

:) Robin in Indiana



TreeGoddess wrote:
I've been *really* working on changing our consumption in our household.
Here's a few links to sites that have helped me along regarding Simple
Living:

Center for Unhindered Living http://www.unhinderedliving.com/index.html
The Center for a New American Dream http://www.newdream.org/
Simple Living http://www.committment.com/simple.html
The Simple Living Network http://www.simpleliving.net/
Organized Home http://organizedhome.com/

Happy Simplicity! ;)

TreeGoddess
